main event: Multiple sightings of groups of small yellowish lights circling Logan, Utah in September 1947 at high speeds and altitudes of several thousand feet with no discernible explanation.
interesting points: The sightings involved small groups of lights, with one incident describing 15-50 small yellow-white objects flying at high speed several thousand feet in the air.
The report includes evaluations and classifications of incidents by Dr. Hynek, with some incidents having a fair or low probability of an astronomical explanation.
Astronomical explanations included possibilities such as high-speed balloons, ordinary aircraft, rockets, flares, falling bodies, reflections, auroral streamers, and birds.
The incidents that remained unexplained showed no clear pattern in terms of time, visibility, nature, geography, or other trends.
One of the sightings involved an elongated object with no sound, traveling much faster than a plane.
witnesses: Civilian Couple and other unidentified people
